div1.head: Letter from Robert C. Gooch to Philip Showalter Hench, March 20, 1941
div1.opener:

THE LIBRARY OF CONGRESS * WASHINGTON
THE READING ROOMS
March 20
1941
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Your letter of February 24, 1941 has been referred to the Reading
Rooms for attention and report.

There is no published report of the Military Governor of Cuba for
1898. A card for the report for 1902 (Card 4-19629) is attached. This
was the last report, as the civil government of Cuba was inaugurated and
the American troops withdrawn on May 20, 1902.

The Department of Havana was established December 30, 1898. It be-
came the Department of Havana and Pinar del Rio (afterwards Department of
Western Cuba), May 1, 1900; and on November 15, 1900 it became the Depart-
ment of Cuba. The reports of the Commanding General, Department of Havana,
covering December 22, 1898 to May 1, 1900 were made by General William
Ludlow. These are covered by card 2-10076 and card 31-1241, which are
attached. We have a printed card for a report of General John R. Brooke,
commanding the Division of Cuba, 1899. It is also attached (card 1-4181).
We do not have any printed cards for any other reports on Cuba which may
have been printed separately, except those of the military governors.
Printed cards for the reports by military governors of Cuba have either
been sent on a previous request or are being enclosed in this present list.

The annual report of the Department of Havana and Pinar del Rio
for 1900, published Aug. 23, 1900 at Quemados, Cuba, bears the title:
“Annual report of Fitzhugh Lee commanding department of Western Cuba”.
This appears in the annual reports of the War Department for 1900 but with-
out the appendixes. [Vol. I, part 3]. The annual reports of the Commanding
General of the Department of Cuba for 1900 and 1901 were published separately
and then republished in the annual reports of the War Department but the
appendixes were omitted. [1900, Vol. I, part 4, 1901, Vol. I, part 3]. The
report of the Commanding General for 1902 appears in volume IX of the War
Department annual reports.

We have no printed card for the separate annual reports of the War
Department. Since these reports are multi-volume sets with many parts we
are indicating those parts which contain material pertinent to Cuba. The
volumes and parts listed below will include the annual reports of the com-
manding generals and will also duplicate some of the material described
on the enclosed cards. War Department reports for 1898, vol. I; for 1899,
vol. I, parts 2, 3, 6; for 1900, vol. I, parts 2, 3, 4, 11, 12; for 1901,
- 2 -
part 3; for 1902, vol. IX.

We do not have printed cards to cover all official documents pertain-
ing to the war of 1898 and the intervention in Cuba, but we are enclosing
certain cards which we have available at this time. The “Checklist of
United States public documents, 1789-1909” and the “Catalogue of public do-
cuments” for the years 1898 to 1902 will reveal other documents of varying
importance. Copies of these two publications should be available in the
library of the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis or at the State Library
at St. Paul.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Robert C. Gooch
Chief of the Book Services Encl.
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester MINNESOTA
